intro: Verbesina macvaughii, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow blooms. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss. The plant produces seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its propagation in dry landscapes.
